Honorary President of Socialist International Arrives
articles.content:
Honorary President of Socialist International Arrives 
    Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Honorary President of Socialist International Guy Spitaels, former president of the Belgian Socialist Party (Wallon), and his party arrived here on Saturday.
 The guests were met at the airport by Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Honorary President of Socialist International Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Honorary President of Socialist International Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung 
    Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Honorary President of Socialist International Guy Spitaels, former president of the Belgian Socialist Party (Wallon), and his party visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Sunday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.
 They made deep bows to the President who lies in state with humble reverence for him who dedicated all his life to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of the people and made an immortal contribution to the human cause of independence.
 Then, the visitors went round with deep emotion the orders and medals and certificates of honorary titles awarded to him in the DPRK and other countries, the Mourning Hall and a train coach and a car he used.    
 The honorary president made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: S. Korean Delegation of Labor Movement Organizations Arrives
articles.content:
S. Korean Delegation of Labor Movement Organizations Arrives 
    Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- A south Korean delegation of labor movement organizations jointly headed by Yun Yong Gyu, chief vice-chairman of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, and Yu Jae Sop, chief vice-chairman of the Federation of south Korean Trade Unions, arrived here today to inspect a joint gathering of working people in the city of Pyongyang for commemorating May Day.
 The delegation was met at the airport by Kim Song Chol and Won Hyong Guk, vice-chairmen of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, and union officials.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded 
    Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Meetings, lectures, photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Sweden, Guinea, Switzerland, Senegal and Indonesia in the period from Apr. 8 to 14 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 On display in the venues of the functions were works of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and photos showing their revolutionary exploits.
 The attendants of the film shows watched Korean films including "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Meets Foreign Heads of State and Prominent Figures".
 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Swiss Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, and others in their speeches at the meetings highly praised Kim Il Sung as a defender of justice, a symbol of independence and father of socialist Korea, adding that the President founded the Juche idea and performed the undying exploits in the cause of global independence.    
 The director of an Indonesian company noted at the film show that Kim Il Sung rendered great services for the growth of the non-aligned movement and made a distinguished contribution to the development of the relations between Indonesia and the DPRK.

articles.title: Functions Held in Different Countries
Actions against FTA Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions against FTA Called for in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Peasants Associations in south Korea reportedly held a meeting in Seoul on April 24 to mark the 16th anniversary of its formation at which it called for actions against the conclusion of the heinous FTA.
 Mun Kyong Sik, chairman of the federation, in a speech condemned the authorities for pushing ahead with negotiations for the conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. FTA, which will totally destroy the south Korean agriculture though south Korean farm products market and rice market have been opened to foreign products under the outsiders' pressure.    
 Peasants and people of other strata in south Korea will surely emerge victorious in the one million-people resistance and check the conclusion of the FTA, he declared.
 Han Sang Ryol, permanent representative chairman of the Reunification Solidarity, and others in their solidarity addresses said it is a historic event that all the people have turned out in a death-defying struggle against the conclusion of the FTA. They called upon the workers, peasants and other people to closely unite as one in the struggle against the U.S. imperialists.

Farm Machines and Vehicles Sent to Co-op Farms
articles.content:
Farm Machines and Vehicles Sent to Co-op Farms
    Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The DPRK National Defence Commission sent farm machines and vehicles to the cooperative farms in Miru area in North Hwanghae Province.
 The Miru Plain is an intermediary region in Korea which President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il visited several times and devoted all his wisdom and energies to the development of agriculture and the improvement of the standard of the farmers' living.
 Kim Jong Il again visited this area in September last year to indicate ways of bringing about a turn in farming by hastening waterway project and land realignment, raising the fertility of soil and realizing comprehensive mechanization.
 A meeting was held in Singye County on Friday to convey the farm machines and vehicles to the above-said farms.    
 Present there were Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Yong Chun, member of the DPRK National Defence Commission and chief of the general staff of the KPA, Choe Ryong Hae, chief secretary of the North Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Kyong Sik, Minister of Agriculture, officials concerned and agricultural workers.    
 Kim Yong Chun made an address at the meeting.

articles.title: Agreement Signed between Governments of DPRK and India
articles.content:
Agreement Signed between Governments of DPRK and India
    New Delhi, April 26 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation in the field of information between the governments of the DPRK and India was signed here on Apr. 26.
 Present at a signing ceremony from the DPRK side were the information delegation headed by the vice-chairman of the DPRK Information Committee and the DPRK ambassador to India, and from the Indian side the assistant secretary of the Indian Ministry of Information and Broadcasting and officials concerned.
 The agreement was inked by the vice-chairman of the DPRK Information Committee and the assistant secretary of the Indian Ministry.
